Package basic

Class SingleGame

java.lang.Object
basic.SingleGame
public class SingleGame extends Object
The `SingleGame` class represents a game of bowling. It allows to add shots, calculate scores, and keep track of game progress.
Author:
aynur

    • SingleGame

      public SingleGame()
      Constructs a new instance of the `SingleGame` class. Initializes the game state, including shots, total points, current frame, and frame displays.

      public void resetGame()

    • addShot

      public void addShot(int pins)
      Adds a bowling shot to the game, updating the game state and scores accordingly.
      Parameters:
      pins - The number of pins knocked down in the current shot.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the game is already over.
      InvalidPinCountException - If the number of pins is not within the valid range.

    • dealWithBonusShot

      public void dealWithBonusShot(int pins)
      Handles the bonus shots in the last frame of a bowling game, updating the game state and scores accordingly.
      Parameters:
      pins - The number of pins knocked down in the bonus shot.
      Throws:
      InvalidPinCountException - If the number of pins is not within the valid range.

    • updatePinsInFrame

      public void updatePinsInFrame(int frameNumber, int shotNumber)
      Updates the representation of pins knocked down in each frame for display purposes.
      Parameters:
      frameNumber - The index of the frame to be updated.
      shotNumber - The current shot within the frame (0 for the first shot, 1 for the second, 2 for bonus).

    • updatePointsInFrame

      public void updatePointsInFrame(int frameNumber)
      Updates the representation of total points scored in each frame for display purposes.
      Parameters:
      frameNumber - The index of the frame to be updated.
